alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Chester; Western Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern New Castle, western Salem, eastern Chester and southwestern Delaware Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glenmoore to Westtown to near Mount Pleasant. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Middletown, West Chester, Chester, Phoenixville, Pennsville, Westtown, Carneys Point, Downingtown, Elsmere, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Delaware City, Newport, Arden, Stanton, Cheyney, Talleyville and Elam. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 304 and 321. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 5 and 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern Delaware...southern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
